Hi Noah,
i want only one step away from my seed. 

So: 
1. www.domain-a.com=
 have a link to -> www.domain-a.com/site-1
2. www.domain-a.com/site-1 link =
to -> www.domain-b.com/site-2 (external) 
3. crawl only www.domain-b.com/si=
te-2 and make a dns check

In some cases i have a dns lookup in hosts.txt. =
But it seems only when the DNS Lookup not failed. 

What did i need for set=
tings ?

best regards
Tom






--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noa=
h Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:
>
> Hello Tom,
> 
> Not sure I fully understa=
nd what you're trying to accomplish. Do you 
> want to follow all links? In=
 that case, change the initial 
> RejectDecideRule in your scope to an Acce=
ptDecideRule. Do you want to 
> crawl links one hop off from the initial si=
tes? Then you may want to try 
> alsoCheckVia. Or are you trying to do some=
thing more complicated, like 
> dns lookups for all offsite links, even if =
the links themselves are not 
> crawled? In that case you might need to wri=
te a custom extractor and 
> perhaps custom scope rules as well.
> 
> Noah
=
>

nt to crawl a domain with some external links.

eported in the WARC Files.

Config:

etchDns" class=3D"org.archive.modules.fetcher.FetchDNS">

erty name=3D"acceptNonDnsResolves" value=3D"true" />

 name=3D"digestContent" value=3D"false" />

igestAlgorithm" value=3D"sha1" />
